alert.note: Alert for Logan (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 21 at 9:33PM MDT until June 22 at 4:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, Logan. * WHEN...Until 330 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 933 PM MDT, Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain fell earlier. - This includes the following streams and drainages... East Lewis Creek, South Platte River, Beall Creek, Pawnee Inlet Number 1, Spring Creek, George Creek, Brush Creek, Twomile Creek, Darby Creek, Springdale Creek, Baymer Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Pawnee Creek, Sand Creek and Cow Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sterling, Merino, Iliff, Peetz, North Sterling Reservoir, Logan Corners, Padroni, Atwood, Pawnee Pass, Westplains and Willard.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
